answers.answer: Hi,When a limb is paralysed we think that it means no sensations can be felt, however, this is not always true. A paralysed limb still feels sensations, but they are not normal and the person experiencing it cannot move it. The sensations can be hot, cold, burning, sharp pains, dull aches etc. It all depends on the cause. If it is a neurological disorder, then the sensations can be anything from absolutely no pain & numbness, to sharp stabbing type pains. If this has been a problem for any length of time it needs to be investigated.Hope this has helped in some way

HiWelcome to the MedHelp forum!In all probability you have a pinched nerve or a peripheral neuropathy due to diabetes or hypothyroidism or low Vit B12. Multiple sclerosis, anxiety and panic disorder could also be a cause. Get this investigated.Please consult your PCP for primary examination followed by proper referral. Hope this helps. Take care!

question: What is it called when you can feel a limb, but you can't control it? It's not paralyzed if I can feel it. It doesn't hurt like a pinched nerve. I simply can't will it to move?
title: Can't control limb
